books.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:1
verses.text: On the Holy Spirit Book III: Chapter I.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:2
verses.text: Not only were the prophets and apostles sent by the Spirit, but also the Son of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:3
verses.text: This is proved from Isaiah and the evangelists, and it is explained why St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:4
verses.text: Luke wrote that the same Spirit descended like a dove upon Christ and abode upon Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:5
verses.text: Next, after establishing this mission of Christ, the writer infers that the Son is sent by the Father and the Spirit, as the Spirit is by the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:7
verses.text: In the former book we have shown by the clear evidence of the Scriptures that the apostles and prophets were appointed, the latter to prophesy, the former to preach the Gospel, by the Holy Spirit in the same way as by the Father and the Son; now we add what all will rightly wonder at, and not be able to doubt, that the Spirit was upon Christ; and that as He sent the Spirit, so the Spirit sent the Son of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:8
verses.text: For the Son of God says: "The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me, because He hath anointed Me, He hath sent Me to preach the Gospel to the poor, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and sight to the blind".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:9
verses.text: And having read this from the Book of Isaiah, He says in the Gospel: "To-day hath this Scripture been fulfilled in your ears;" that He might point out that it was said of Himself.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:11
verses.text: Can we, then, wonder if the Spirit sent both the prophets and the apostles, since Christ said: "The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me"? And rightly did He say "upon Me," because He was speaking as the Son of Man.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:12
verses.text: For as the Son of Man He  was anointed and sent to preach the Gospel.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:13
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:14
verses.text: But if they believe not the Son, let them hear the Father also saying that the Spirit of the Lord is upon Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:15
verses.text: For He says to John: "Upon whomsoever thou shalt see the Spirit descending from heaven and abiding upon Him, He it is Who baptizeth with the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:16
verses.text: God the Father said this to John, and John heard and saw and believed.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:17
verses.text: He heard from God, he saw in the Lord, he believed that it was the Spirit Who was coming down from heaven.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:18
verses.text: For it was not a dove that descended, but the Holy Spirit as a dove; for thus it is written: "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven as a dove".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:20
verses.text: As John says that he saw, so, too, wrote Mark; Luke, however, added that the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form as a dove; you must not think that this was an incarnation, but an appearance.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:21
verses.text: He, then, brought the appearance before him, that by means of the appearance he might believe who did not see the Spirit, and that by the appearance He might manifest that He had a share of the one honour in authority, the one operation in the mystery, the one gift in the bath, together with the Father and the Son; unless perchance we consider Him in Whom the Lord was baptized too weak for the servant to be baptized in Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:22
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:23
verses.text: And he said fittingly, "abiding upon Him," because the Spirit inspired a saying or acted upon the prophets as often as He would, but abode always in Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:24
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:25
verses.text: Nor, again, let it move you that he said "upon Him," for he was speaking of the Son of Man, because he was baptized as the Son of Man.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:26
verses.text: For the Spirit is not upon Christ, according to the Godhead, but in Christ; for, as the Father is in the Son, and the Son in the Father, so the Spirit of God and the Spirit of Christ is both in the Father and in the Son, for He is the Spirit of His mouth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:27
verses.text: For He Who is of God abides in God, as it is written: "But we received not the spirit of this world, but the Spirit which is of God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:28
verses.text: And He abides in Christ, Who has received from Christ; for it is written again: "He shall take of Mine:" and elsewhere: "The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and death".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:29
verses.text: He is, then, not over Christ according to the Godhead of Christ, for the Trinity is not over Itself, but over all things: It is not over Itself but in Itself.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:30
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:31
verses.text: Who, then, can doubt that the Spirit sent the prophets and apostles, since the Son of God says: "The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:32
verses.text: And elsewhere: "I am the First, and I am also for ever, and Mine hand hath founded the earth, and My right hand hath established the heaven; I will call them and they shall stand up together, and shall all be gathered together and shall hear.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:33
verses.text: Who hath declared these things to them? Because I loved thee I performed thy pleasure against Babylon, that the seed of the Chaldaeans might be taken away.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:34
verses.text: I have spoken, and I have called, I have brought him and have made his way prosperous.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:35
verses.text: Come unto Me and hear ye this.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:36
verses.text: From the beginning I have not spoken in secret, I was there when those things were done; and now the Lord God hath sent Me and His Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:37
verses.text: Who is it Who says: The Lord God hath sent Me and His Spirit, except He Who came from the Father that He might save sinners? And, as you hear, the Spirit sent Him, lest when you hear that the Son sends the Spirit, you should believe the Spirit to be of inferior power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:38
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:39
verses.text: So both the Father and the Spirit sent the Son; the Father sent Him, for it is written: "But the Paraclete, the Holy Spirit, Whom the Father will send in My Name".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:40
verses.text: The Son sent Him, for He said: "But when the Paraclete is come, Whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of Truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 1:41
verses.text: If, then, the Son and the Spirit send each other, as the Father sends, there is no inferiority of subjection, but a community of power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:1
verses.text: Chapter II.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:2
verses.text: The Son and the Spirit are alike given; whence not subjection but one Godhead is shown by Its working.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:3
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:4
verses.text: And not only did the Father send the Son, but also gave Him, as the Son Himself gave Himself.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:5
verses.text: For we read: "Grace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, Who gave Himself for our sins".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:6
verses.text: If they think that He was subject in that He was sent, they cannot deny that it was of grace that He was given.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:7
verses.text: But He was given by the Father, as Isaiah said: "Unto us a Child is born, unto us a Son is given;" but He was given, I dare to say it, by the Spirit also, Who was sent by the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:8
verses.text: For since the prophet has not defined by whom  He was given, he shows that He was given by the grace of the Trinity; and inasmuch as the Son Himself gave Himself, He could not be subject to Himself according to His Godhead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:9
verses.text: Therefore that He was given could not be a sign of subjection in the God-head.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:11
verses.text: But the Holy Spirit also was given, for it is written: "I will ask the Father, and He shall give you another Paraclete".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:12
verses.text: And the Apostle says: "Wherefore he that despiseth these things despiseth not man but God, Who hath given us His Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:13
verses.text: Isaiah, too, shows that both the Spirit and the Son are given: "Thus," says he, "saith the Lord God, Who made the heaven and fashioned it, Who stablished the earth, and the things which are in it, and giveth breath to the people upon it, and the Spirit to them that walk upon it".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:14
verses.text: And to the Son: "I am the Lord God, Who have called Thee in righteousness, and will hold Thine hand, and will strengthen Thee; and I have given Thee for a covenant of My people, for a light of the Gentiles, to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out of their fetters those that are bound".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 2:15
verses.text: Since, then, the Son is both sent and given, and the Spirit also is both sent and given, They have assuredly a oneness of Godhead Who have a oneness of action.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:1
verses.text: Chapter III.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:2
verses.text: The same Unity may also be recognized from the fact that the Spirit is called Finger, and the Son Right Hand; for the understanding of divine things is assisted by the usage of human language.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:3
verses.text: The tables of the law were written by this Finger, and they were afterwards broken, and the reason.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:4
verses.text: Lastly, Christ wrote with the same Finger; yet we must not admit any inferiority in the Spirit from this bodily comparison.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:5
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:6
verses.text: So, too, the Spirit is also called the Finger of God, because there is an indivisible and inseparable communion between the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:7
verses.text: For as the Scripture called the Son of God the Right Hand of God, as it is said: "Thy Right Hand, O Lord, is made glorious in power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:8
verses.text: Thy Right Hand, O Lord, hath dashed in pieces the enemy;" so the Holy Spirit is called the Finger of God, as the Lord Himself says: "But if I by the Finger of God cast out devils".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:9
verses.text: For in the same place in another book of the Gospel He named the Spirit of God, as you find: "But if I by the Spirit of God cast out devils".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:11
verses.text: What, then, could have been said to signify more expressly the unity of the Godhead, or of Its working, which Unity is according to the Godhead of the Father, or of the Son, or of the Holy Spirit, than that we should understand that the fulness of the eternal Godhead would seem to be divided far more than this body of ours, if any one were to sever the unity of Substance, and multiply Its powers, whereas the eternity of the same Godhead is one?  13.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:12
verses.text: For oftentimes it is convenient to estimate from our own words those things which are above us, and because we cannot see those things we draw inferences from those which we can see.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:13
verses.text: "For the invisible things of Him," says the Apostle, "from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by those things which are made".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:14
verses.text: And he adds: "His eternal power also and Godhead".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:15
verses.text: Of which one thing seems to be said of the Son, and another of the Holy Spirit; that in the same manner as the Son is called the eternal Power of the Father, so, also, the Spirit, because He is divine, should be believed to be His eternal Godhead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:16
verses.text: For the Son, too, because He ever lives, is eternal life.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:17
verses.text: This Finger, then, of God is both eternal and divine.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:18
verses.text: For what is there belonging to God which is not eternal and divine?  14.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:19
verses.text: With this Finger, as we read, God wrote on those tables of stone which Moses received.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:20
verses.text: For God did not with a finger of flesh write the forms and portions of those letters which we read, but gave the law by His Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:21
verses.text: And so the Apostle says: "For the Law is spiritual, which, indeed, is written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but on fleshy tables of the heart".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:22
verses.text: For if the letter of the Apostle is written in the Spirit, what hinders us from believing that the Law of God was written not with ink, but with the Spirit of God, which certainly does not stain but enlightens the secret places of our heart and mind?  14.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:23
verses.text: Now it was written on tables of stone, because it was written in a type, but the tables were first broken and cast out of the hands of Moses, because the Jews fell away from the works of the prophet.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:24
verses.text: And fitly were the tables broken, not the writing erased.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:25
verses.text: And do you see that your table be not broken, that your mind and soul be not  divided.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:26
verses.text: Is Christ divided? He is not divided, but is one with the Father; and let no one separate you from Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:27
verses.text: If your faith fails, the table of your heart is broken.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:28
verses.text: The coherence of your soul is lessened if you do not believe the unity of Godhead in the Trinity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:29
verses.text: Your faith is written, and your sin is written, as Jeremiah said: "Thy sin, O Judah, is written with a pen of iron and the point of a diamond.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:30
verses.text: And it is written," he says, "on thy breast and on thy heart".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:31
verses.text: The sin, therefore, is there where grace is, but the sin is written with a pen, grace is denoted by the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:32
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:33
verses.text: With this Finger, also, the Lord Jesus, with bowed head, mystically wrote on the ground, when the adulteress was brought before Him by the Jews, signifying in a figure that, when we judge of the sins of another, we ought to remember our own.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:34
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:35
verses.text: And lest, again, because God wrote the Law by His Spirit, we should believe any inferiority, as it were, concerning the ministry of the Spirit, or from the consideration of our own body should think the Spirit to be a small part of God, the Apostle says, elsewhere, that he does not speak with words of human wisdom, but in words taught by the Spirit, and that he compares spiritual things with spiritual; but that the natural man receiveth not the things which pertain to the Spirit of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:36
verses.text: For he knew that he who compared divine with carnal things was amongst natural things, and not to be reckoned amongst spiritual men; "for they are foolishness," he says, "unto him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 3:37
verses.text: And so, because he knew that these questions would arise amongst natural men, foreseeing the future he says: "For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct Him? But we have the mind of Christ".

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:1
verses.text: Chapter IV.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:2
verses.text: To those who contend that the Spirit because He is called the Finger is less than the Father, St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:3
verses.text: Ambrose replies that this would also tend to the lessening of the Son, Who is called the Right Hand.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:4
verses.text: That these names are to be referred only to the Unity, for which reason Moses proclaimed that the whole Trinity worked in the passage of the Red Sea.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:5
verses.text: And, indeed, it is no wonder that the operation of the Spirit found place there, where there was a figure of baptism, since the Scripture teaches that the Three Persons equally sanctify and are operative in that sacrament.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:7
verses.text: But if any one is still entangled in carnal doubts, and hesitates because of bodily figures, let him consider that he cannot think rightly of the Son who can think wrongly of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:8
verses.text: For if some think that the Spirit is a certain small portion of God, because He is called the Finger of God, the same persons must certainly maintain that a small portion only is in the Son of God, because He is called the Right Hand of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:10
verses.text: But the Son is called both the Right Hand and the Power of God; if, then, we consider our words, there can be no perfection without power; let them therefore take care lest they think that which it is impious to say, namely, that the Father being but half perfect in His own Substance received perfection through the Son, and let them cease to deny that the Son is co-eternal with the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:11
verses.text: For when did the Power of God not exist? But if they think that at any time the Power of God existed not, they will say that at some time Perfection existed not in God the Father, to Whom they think that Power was at some time wanting.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:12
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:13
verses.text: But, as I said, these things are written that we may refer them to the Unity of the Godhead, and believe that which the Apostle said, that the fulness of the Godhead dwells bodily in Christ, which dwells also in the Father, and dwells in the Holy Spirit; and that, as there is a unity of the Godhead, so also is there a unity of operation.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:15
verses.text: And this may also be gathered from the Song of Moses, for he, after leading the people of the Jews through the sea, acknowledged the operation of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, saying: "Thy Right Hand, O Lord, is glorious in power, Thy Right Hand, O Lord, hath dashed in pieces the enemy".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:16
verses.text: Here you have his confession of the Son and of the Father, Whose Right Hand He is.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:17
verses.text: And farther on, not to pass by the Holy Spirit, He added: "Thou didst send Thy Spirit and the sea covered them, and the water was divided by the Spirit of Thine anger".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:18
verses.text: By which is signified the unity of the Godhead, not an inequality of the Trinity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:20
verses.text: You see, then, that the Holy Spirit also co-operated with the Father and the Son, so that just as if the waves were congealed in the midst of the sea, a wall as it were of water rose up for the passage of the Jews, and then, poured back again by the Spirit, overwhelmed the people of the Egyptians.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:21
verses.text: And many think that from the same origin the pillar of cloud went before the people of the Jews by day, and the pillar of fire by  night, that the grace of the Spirit might protect His people.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:22
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:23
verses.text: Now that this operation of God, which the whole world rightly wonders at, did not take place without the work of the Holy Spirit, the Apostle also declared when he said that the truth of a spiritual mystery was prefigured in it, for we read as follows: "For our fathers were all under the cloud, and all passed through the sea, and were all baptized in Moses in the cloud and in the sea, and did all eat the same spiritual meat, and did all drink the same spiritual drink".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:24
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:25
verses.text: For how without the operation of the Holy Spirit could there be the type of a sacrament, the whole truth of which is in the Spirit? As the Apostle also set forth, saying: "But ye were washed, but ye were sanctified, but ye were justified in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ, and in the Spirit of our God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:26
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:27
verses.text: You see, then, that the Father works in the Son, and that the Son works in the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:28
verses.text: And therefore do not doubt that, according to the order of Scripture, there was in the figure that which the Truth Himself declared to be in the truth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:29
verses.text: For who can deny His operation in the Font, in which we feel His operation and grace?  25.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:30
verses.text: For as the Father sanctifies, so, too, the Son sanctifies, and the Holy Spirit sanctifies.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:31
verses.text: The Father sanctifies according to that which is written: "The God of peace sanctify you, and may your spirit, soul, and body be preserved entire without blame in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:32
verses.text: And elsewhere the Son says: "Father, sanctify them in the truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:34
verses.text: But of the Son the same Apostle said: "Who was made unto us wisdom from God, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:35
verses.text: Do you see that He was made sanctification? But He was made so unto us, not that He should change that which He was, but that He might sanctify us in the flesh.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:36
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:37
verses.text: And the Apostle also teaches that the Holy Spirit sanctifies.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:38
verses.text: For he speaks thus: "We are bound to give thanks to God always for you, brethren dearly beloved of the Lord; because God chose you as first-fruits unto salvation, in sanctification of the Spirit, and belief of the truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:39
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 4:40
verses.text: So, then, the Father sanctifies, the Son also sanctifies, and the Holy Spirit sanctifies; but the sanctification is one, for baptism is one, and the grace of the sacrament is one.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:1
verses.text: Chapter V.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:2
verses.text: The writer sums up the argument he had commenced, and confirms the statement that unity is signified by the terms finger and right hand, from the fact that the works of God are the same as are the works of hands; and that those of hands are the same as those of fingers; and lastly, that the term hand applies equally to the Son and the Spirit, and that of finger applies to the Spirit and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:3
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:4
verses.text: But what wonder is it if He Who Himself needs no sanctification, but abounds therewith, sanctifies each man; since, as I said, we have been taught that His Majesty is so great, that the Holy Spirit seems to be as inseparable from God the Father as the finger is from the body?  30.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:5
verses.text: But if any one thinks that this should be referred not to the oneness of power, but to its lessening, he indeed will fall into such madness as to appear to fashion the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit as it were into one bodily form, and to picture to himself certain distinctions of its members.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:7
verses.text: But let them learn, as I have often said, that not inequality but unity of power is signified by this testimony; inasmuch as things which are the works of God are also the works of hands, and we read that the same are the works of fingers.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:8
verses.text: For it is written: "The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth the work of His hands;" and elsewhere: "In the beginning Thou didst found the earth, O Lord; and the heavens are the works of Thy hands".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:9
verses.text: So, then, the works of the hands are the same as the works of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:10
verses.text: There is not therefore any distinction of the work according to the kind of bodily members, but a oneness of power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:11
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:12
verses.text: But those which are the works of the hands are also the works of the fingers, for it is equally written: "For I will behold Thy heavens, the works of Thy fingers, the moon, and the stars, which Thou hast established".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:13
verses.text: What less are the fingers here said to have made than the hands, since they made the same as the hands, as it is written: "For Thou, Lord, hast made me glad through Thy work, and in the works of Thy hands will I rejoice".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:15
verses.text: And yet since we read that the Son is the hand (for it is written: "Hath not My Hand made all these things?" and elsewhere: "I will place thee in the cleft of the rock, and I will cover thee with Mine hand, I have placed My hand under the covering of the rock," which refers to the mystery of  the Incarnation, because the eternal Power of God took on Itself the covering of a body), it is certainly clear that Scripture used the term hand both of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:16
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:17
verses.text: And again, since we read that the Spirit is the finger of God, we think that fingers [in the plural] are spoken of to signify the Son and Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 5:18
verses.text: Lastly, that he may state that he received the sanctification both of the Son and of the Spirit, a certain saint says: "Thy hands have made me and fashioned me".

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:1
verses.text: Chapter VI.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:2
verses.text: The Spirit rebukes just as do the Father and the Son; and indeed judges could not judge without Him, as is shown by the judgments of Solomon and Daniel, which are explained in a few words, by the way; and no other than the Holy Spirit inspired Daniel.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:3
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:4
verses.text: Why do we reject like words when we assert the oneness of power, since the oneness of power extends so far that the Spirit rebukes, as the Father rebukes, and as the Son rebukes.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:5
verses.text: For so it is written: "O Lord, rebuke me not in Thine anger, neither chasten me in Thy displeasure".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:6
verses.text: Then in the forty-ninth [fiftieth] Psalm, the Lord speaks thus: "I will rebuke thee, and will set thy sins before thy face".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:7
verses.text: And in like manner the Son said of the Holy Spirit: "When I go away, I will send the Paraclete to you.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:8
verses.text: And He, when He is come, will rebuke the world, concerning sin, and concerning righteousness, and concerning judgment".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:10
verses.text: But whither is the madness of faithless men leading us, so that we appear to be proving, as if it were a matter of doubt, that the Holy Spirit rebukes, whereas judges themselves are unable to judge, except through the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:11
verses.text: Lastly, that famous judgment of Solomon, when, amongst the difficulties arising from those who were contending, as one, having overlain the child which she had borne, wished to claim the child of another, and the other was protecting her own son, he both discovered deceit in the very hidden thoughts, and affection in the mother's heart, was certainly so admirable only by the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:12
verses.text: For no other sword would have penetrated the hidden feeling of those women, except the sword of the Spirit, of which the Lord says: "I am not come to send peace but a sword".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:13
verses.text: For the inmost mind cannot be penetrated by steel, but by the Spirit: "For the Spirit of understanding is holy, one only, manifold, subtle, lively," and, farther on, "overseeing all things".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:15
verses.text: Consider what the prophet says, that He oversees all things.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:16
verses.text: And so Solomon also oversaw, so that he ordered that sword to be brought, because while pretending that he intended to divide the infant, he reflected that the true mother would have more regard for her son than for her comfort, and would set kindness before right, not right before kindness.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:17
verses.text: But that she who feigned the feelings of a mother, blinded by the desire of gaining her end, would think little of the destruction of him in regard to whom she felt no outgoing of tenderness.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:18
verses.text: And so that spiritual man, that he might judge all things (for he that is spiritual judgeth all things), sought in the feelings the natural disposition which was concealed in the language, and questioned tenderness that he might set forth the truth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:19
verses.text: So the mother overcame by the affection of love, which is a fruit of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:20
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:21
verses.text: He judges in a prophet, for the word of wisdom is given by the Spirit; how, then, do men deny that the Spirit can rebuke the world concerning judgment, Who removes doubt from judgment, and grants the successful issue?  39.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:22
verses.text: Daniel also, unless he had received the Spirit of God, would never have been able to discover that lustful adultery, that fraudulent lie.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:23
verses.text: For when Susanna, assailed by the conspiracy of the elders, saw that the mind of the people was moved by consideration for the old men, and destitute of all help, alone amongst men, conscious of her chastity she prayed God to judge; it is written: "The Lord heard her voice, when she was being led to be put to death, and the Lord raised up the Holy Spirit of a young youth, whose name was Daniel".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:24
verses.text: And so according to the grace of the Holy Spirit received by him, he discovered the varying evidence of the treacherous, for it was none other than the operation of divine power, that his voice should make them whose inward feelings were concealed to be known.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:25
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:26
verses.text: Understand, then, the sacred and heavenly miracle of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:27
verses.text: She who preferred to be chaste in herself, rather than in the opinion of the people, she who preferred to hazard [the reputation of] her innocence, rather than her modesty, who  when she was accused was silent, when she was condemned held her peace, content with the judgment of her own conscience, who preserved regard for her modesty even in peril, that they who were not able to force her chastity might not seem to have forced her to petulance; when she called upon the Lord, she obtained the Spirit, Who made known the hidden consciousness of the elders.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:28
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:29
verses.text: Let the chaste learn not to dread calumny.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:30
verses.text: For she who preferred chastity to life did not suffer the loss of life, and retained the glory of chastity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:31
verses.text: So, too, Abraham, once bidden to go to foreign lands, and not being held back either by the danger to his wife's modesty, nor by the fear of death before him, preserved both his own life and his wife's chastity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:32
verses.text: So no one has ever repented of trusting God, and chastity increased devotion in Sarah, and devotion chastity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:34
verses.text: And lest any one should perhaps think that, as the Scripture says, "God raised up the Holy Spirit of a young youth," the Spirit in him was that of a man, not the Holy Spirit, let him read farther on, and he will find that Daniel received the Holy Spirit, and therefore prophesied.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:35
verses.text: Lastly, too, the king advanced him because he had the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:36
verses.text: For he speaks thus: "Thou, O Daniel, art able, forasmuch as the Holy Spirit of God is in thee".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:37
verses.text: And farther on it is written: "And Daniel was set over them, because an excellent Spirit was in him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 6:38
verses.text: And the Spirit of Moses also was distributed to those who were to be judges.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:1
verses.text: Chapter VII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:2
verses.text: The Son Himself does not judge or punish without the Spirit, so that the same Spirit is called the Sword of the Word.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:3
verses.text: But inasmuch as the Word is in turn called the Sword of the Spirit, the highest unity of power is thereby recognized in each.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:4
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:5
verses.text: But what should we say of the other points? We have heard that the Lord Jesus not only judges in the Spirit but punishes also.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:6
verses.text: For neither would He punish Antichrist, whom, as we read, "the Lord Jesus shall slay with the Spirit of His mouth," unless He had before judged of his deserts.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:7
verses.text: Yet here is not a grace received, but the unity remains undivided, since neither can Christ be without the Spirit, nor the Spirit without Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:8
verses.text: For the unity of the divine nature cannot be divided.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:10
verses.text: And since that instance comes before us, that the Lord Jesus shall slay with the Spirit of His mouth, the Spirit is understood to be as it were the Sword of the Word.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:11
verses.text: Lastly, in the Gospel also the Lord Jesus Himself says: "I came not to send peace but a sword".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:12
verses.text: For He came that He might give the Spirit; and so there is in His mouth a two-edged sword, which is in truth the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:13
verses.text: So the Spirit is the Sword of the Word.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:15
verses.text: And that you may know that there is no inequality but unity of nature, the Word also is the Sword of the Holy Spirit, for it is written: "Taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye may be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked one.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:16
verses.text: And take the helmet of Salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:17
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 7:18
verses.text: Since, then, the Sword of the Word is the Holy Spirit, and the Sword of the Holy Spirit is the Word of God, there is certainly in Them oneness of power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:1
verses.text: Chapter VIII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:2
verses.text: The aforesaid unity is proved hereby, that as the Father is said to be grieved and tempted, so too the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:3
verses.text: The Son was also tempted in the wilderness, where a figure of the cross was set up in the brazen serpent: but the Apostle says that the Spirit also was there tempted.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:4
verses.text: St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:5
verses.text: Ambrose infers from this that the Israelites were guided into the promised land by the same Spirit, and that His will and power are one with those of the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:7
verses.text: And we may behold this unity also in other passages of the Scriptures.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:8
verses.text: For whereas Ezekiel says to the people of the Jews: "And thou hast grieved Me in all these things, saith the Lord;" Paul says to the new people in his Epistle: "Grieve not the Holy Spirit of God, in Whom ye were sealed".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:9
verses.text: Again, whereas Isaiah says of the Jews themselves: "But they believed not, but grieved the Holy Spirit;" David says of God: "They grieved the Most High in the desert, and tempted God in their hearts".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:11
verses.text: Understand also that whereas Scripture in other places says that the Spirit was tempted, and that God was tempted, it says also that Christ was tempted; for you have the Apostle saying to the Corinthians: "Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by serpents".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:12
verses.text: Just was the punishment that the adversaries should feel the venom, who had not venerated the Maker.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:13
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:14
verses.text: And well did the Lord ordain that by the lifting up of the brazen serpent the wounds of those who were bitten should be healed; for the brazen serpent is a type of the Cross; for although in His flesh Christ was lifted up, yet in Him was the Apostle crucified to the world and the world to him; for he says: "The world hath been crucified unto me, and I unto the world".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:15
verses.text: "So the world was crucified in its allurements, and therefore not a real but a brazen serpent was hanged; because the Lord took on Him the likeness of a sinner, in the truth, indeed, of His Body, but without the truth of sin, that imitating a serpent through the deceitful appearance of human weakness, having laid aside the slough of the flesh, He might destroy the cunning of the true serpent.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:16
verses.text: And therefore in the Cross of the Lord, which came to man's help in avenging temptation, I, who accept the medicine of the Trinity, recognize in the wicked the offence against the Trinity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:17
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:18
verses.text: Therefore when you find in the book of Moses, that the Lord being tempted sent serpents on the people of the Jews, it is necessary that you either confess the Unity of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit in the Divine Majesty, or certainly when the writing of the Apostle says that the Spirit was tempted, it undoubtedly pointed out the Spirit by the name of Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:19
verses.text: But the Apostle writing to the Hebrews says that the Spirit was tempted, for you find this: "Wherefore the Holy Ghost saith this: Today if ye shall hear His voice, harden not your hearts, like as in the provocation in the day of temptation in the wilderness, where your fathers tempted Me, proved Me, and saw My works.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:20
verses.text: Forty years was I near to this generation and said: They do alway err in their heart; but they did not know My ways, as I sware in My wrath, If they shall enter into My rest".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:21
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:22
verses.text: Therefore, according to the Apostle, the Spirit was tempted.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:23
verses.text: If He was tempted, He also certainly was guiding the people of the Jews into the land of promise, as it is written: "For He led them through the deep, as a horse through the wilderness, and they laboured not, and like the cattle through the plain.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:24
verses.text: The Spirit came down from the Lord and guided them".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:25
verses.text: And He certainly ministered to them the calm rain of heavenly food, He with fertile shower made fruitful that daily harvest which earth had not brought forth, and husbandman had not sown.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:26
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:27
verses.text: Now let us look at these points one by one.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:28
verses.text: God had promised rest to the Jews; the Spirit calls that rest His.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:29
verses.text: God the Father relates that He was tempted by the unbelieving, and the Spirit says that He was tempted by the same, for the temptation is one wherewith the one Godhead of the Trinity was tempted by the unbelieving.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:30
verses.text: God condemns the people of the Jews, so that they cannot attain to the land flowing with milk and honey, that is, to the rest of the resurrection; and the Spirit condemns them by the same decree: "If they shall enter into My rest".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 8:31
verses.text: It is, then, the decree of one Will, the excellency of one Power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:1
verses.text: Chapter IX.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:2
verses.text: That the Holy Spirit is provoked is proved by the words of St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:3
verses.text: Peter, in which it is shown that the Spirit of God is one and the same as the Spirit of the Lord, both by other passages and by reference to the sentence of the same Apostle on Ananias and Sapphira, whence it is argued that the union of the Holy Spirit with the Father and the Son, as well as His own Godhead, is proved.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:4
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:5
verses.text: Perhaps, however, some one might say that this passage cannot be specially applied to the Holy Spirit, had not the same Apostle Peter taught us in another place that the Holy Ghost can be tempted by our sins, for you find that the wife of Ananias is thus addressed: "Why have ye agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?" For the Spirit of the Lord is the very Spirit of God; for there is one Holy Spirit, as also the Apostle Paul taught, saying: "But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:6
verses.text: But if any man hath not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of His".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:7
verses.text: He first mentioned the Spirit of God and immediately adds that the Same is the Spirit of Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:8
verses.text: And having spoken of the Spirit, that we might understand that where the Holy Spirit is there is Christ, he added: "But if Christ be in you".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:10
verses.text: Then, in the same way as we here understand that where the Spirit is there also is Christ; so also, elsewhere, he shows that where Christ is, there also is the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:11
verses.text: For having said: "Do ye seek a proof of Christ Who speaketh in me?" he says elsewhere: "For I think that I also  have the Spirit of God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:12
verses.text: The Unity, then, is inseparable, for by the testimony of Scripture where either the Father or the Son or the Holy Spirit is designated, there is all the fulness of the Trinity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:13
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:14
verses.text: But Peter himself in the instance we have brought forward spoke first of the Holy Spirit, and then called Him the Spirit of the Lord, for you read as follows: "Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to deal fraudulently concerning the price of the field? While it remained did it not continue thine own, and when sold was it not in thy power? Why hast thou conceived this wickedness in thy heart? Thou hast not lied unto men but unto God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:15
verses.text: And below he says to the wife: "Why have ye agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?"  57.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:16
verses.text: First, we understand that he called the Holy Spirit the Spirit of the Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:17
verses.text: Then, since he mentioned first the Holy Spirit and added: "Thou hast not lied unto men but unto God," you must necessarily either understand the oneness of the Godhead in the Holy Spirit, since when the Holy Spirit is tempted a lie is told to God; or, if you endeavour to exclude the oneness of the Godhead, you yourself according to the words of Scripture certainly believe Him to be God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:18
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:19
verses.text: For if we understand that these expressions are used both of the Spirit and of the Father, we certainly observe the unity of truth and knowledge in God the Father and the Holy Spirit, for falsehood is discovered alike by the Holy Spirit and by God the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:20
verses.text: But if we have received each truth concerning the Spirit, why do you, faithless man, attempt to deny what you read? Confess, then, either the oneness of the Godhead of the Father, of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, or the Godhead of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 9:21
verses.text: Whichever you say, you will have said each in God, for both the Unity upholds the Godhead and the Godhead the Unity.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:1
verses.text: Chapter X.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:2
verses.text: The Divinity of the Holy Spirit is supported by a passage of St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:3
verses.text: John.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:4
verses.text: This passage was, indeed, erased by heretics, but it is a vain attempt, since their faithlessness could thereby more easily be convicted.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:5
verses.text: The order of the context is considered in order that this passage may be shown to refer to the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:6
verses.text: He is born of the Spirit who is born again of the same Spirit, of Whom Christ Himself is believed to have been born and born again.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:7
verses.text: Again, the Godhead of the Spirit is inferred from two testimonies of St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:8
verses.text: John; and lastly, it is explained how the Spirit, the water, and the blood are called witnesses.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:10
verses.text: Nor does the Scripture in this place alone bear witness to the θεότης, that is, the Godhead of the Holy Spirit; but also the Lord Himself said in the Gospel: "The Spirit is God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:11
verses.text: Which passage you, Arians, so expressly testify to be said concerning the Spirit, that you remove it from your copies, and would that it were from yours and not also from those of the Church! For at the time when Auxentius had seized the Church of Milan with the arms and forces of impious unbelief, the Church of Sirmium was attacked by Valens and Ursatius, when their priests [i-e: bishops] failed in faith; this falsehood and sacrilege of yours was found in the ecclesiastical books.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:12
verses.text: And it may chance that you did the same in the past.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:13
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:14
verses.text: And you have indeed been able to blot out the letters, but could not remove the faith.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:15
verses.text: That erasure betrayed you more, that erasure condemned you more; and you were not able to obliterate the truth, but that erasure blotted out your names from the book of life.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:16
verses.text: Why was the passage removed, "For God is a Spirit," if it did not pertain to the Spirit? For if you will have it that the expression is used of God the Father, you, who think it should be erased, deny, in consequence, God the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:17
verses.text: Choose which you will, in each the snare of your own impiety will bind you if you confess yourselves to be heathen by denying either the Father or the Spirit to be God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:18
verses.text: Therefore your confession wherein you have blotted out the Word of God remains, while you fear the original.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:20
verses.text: You have blotted it out, indeed, in your breasts and minds, but the Word of  God is not blotted out, the Holy Spirit is not blotted out, but turns away from impious minds; not grace but iniquity is blotted out; for it is written: "I am He, I am He that blot out thine iniquities".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:21
verses.text: Lastly, Moses, making request for the people, says: "Blot me out of Thy book, if Thou sparest not this people".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:22
verses.text: And yet he was not blotted out, because he had no iniquity, but grace flowed forth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:24
verses.text: You are, then, convicted by your own confession that you cannot say it was done with wisdom but with cunning.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:25
verses.text: For by cunning you know that you are convicted by the evidence of that passage, and that your arguments cannot apply against that testimony.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:26
verses.text: For whence else could the meaning of that place be derived, since the whole tenour of the passage is concerning the Spirit?  63.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:27
verses.text: Nicodemus enquires about regeneration, and the Lord replies: "Verily, verily, I say unto thee, except a man be born again by water and the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:28
verses.text: And that He might show that there is one birth according to the flesh, and another according to the Spirit, He added: "That which is born of the flesh is flesh, because it is born of the flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is Spirit, because the Spirit is God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:29
verses.text: Follow out the whole course of the passage, and you will find that God has shut out your impiety by the fulness of His statement: "Marvel not," says He, "that I said, Ye must be born again.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:30
verses.text: The Spirit breatheth where He listeth, and thou hearest His voice, but knowest not whence He cometh or whither He goeth, so is every one who is born of the Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:31
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:32
verses.text: Who is he who is born of the Spirit, and is made Spirit, but he who is renewed in the Spirit of his mind? This certainly is he who is regenerated by water and the Holy Spirit, since we receive the hope of eternal life through the laver of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:33
verses.text: And elsewhere the Apostle Peter says: "Ye shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:34
verses.text: For who is he that is baptized with the Holy Spirit but he who is born again through water and the Holy Spirit? Therefore the Lord said of the Holy Spirit, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, except a man be born again by water and the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:35
verses.text: And therefore He declared that we are born of Him in the latter case, through Whom He said that we were born in the former.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:36
verses.text: This is the sentence of the Lord; I rest on what is written, not on argument.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:37
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:38
verses.text: I ask, however, why, if there be no doubt that we are born again by the Holy Spirit, there should be any doubt that we are born of the Holy Spirit, since the Lord Jesus Himself was both born and born again of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:39
verses.text: And if you confess that He was born of the Holy Spirit, because you are not able to deny it, but deny that He was born again, it is great folly to confess what is peculiar to God, and deny what is common to men.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:40
verses.text: And therefore that is well said to you which was said to the Jews: "If I told you earthly things and ye believe not, how shall ye believe if I tell you heavenly things?"  66.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:41
verses.text: And yet we find each passage so written in Greek, that He said not, through the Spirit, but of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:42
verses.text: For it stands thus: ἀμήν, ἀμήν, λέγω σοι, ἐὰν μή τις γεννηθῇ ἐξ ὓδατος και Πνεύματος, that is, of water and the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:43
verses.text: Therefore, since one ought not to doubt that "that which is born of the Spirit" is written of the Holy Spirit; there is no doubt but that the Holy Spirit also is God, according to that which is written, "the Spirit is God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:44
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:45
verses.text: But the same Evangelist, that he might make it plain that he wrote this concerning the Holy Spirit, says elsewhere: "Jesus Christ came by water and blood, not in the water only, but by water and blood.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:46
verses.text: And the Spirit beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth; for there are three witnesses, the Spirit, the water, and the blood; and these three are one".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:47
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:48
verses.text: Hear how they are witnesses: The Spirit renews the mind, the water is serviceable for the laver, and the blood refers to the price.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:49
verses.text: For the Spirit made us children by adoption, the water of the sacred Font washed us, the blood of the Lord redeemed us.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:50
verses.text: So we obtain one invisible and one visible testimony in a spiritual sacrament, for "the Spirit Himself beareth witness to our spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 10:51
verses.text: Though the fulness of the sacrament be in each, yet there is a distinction of office; so where there is distinction of office, there certainly is not equality of witness.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:1
verses.text: Chapter XI.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:2
verses.text: The objection has been made, that the words of St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:3
verses.text: John, "The Spirit is God," are to be referred to God the Father; since Christ afterwards declares that God is to be worshipped in Spirit and in truth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:4
verses.text: The answer is, first, that by the word Spirit is sometimes meant spiritual grace; next, it is shown that, if they insist that the Person of the Holy Spirit is signified by the words "in Spirit," and therefore deny that adoration is due to Him, the argument tells equally against the Son; and since numberless passages prove that He is to be worshipped, we understand from this that the same rule is to be laid down as regards the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:5
verses.text: Why are we commanded to fall down before His footstool? Because by this is signified the Lord's Body, and as the Spirit was the Maker of this, it follows that He is to be worshipped, and yet it does not accordingly follow that Mary is to be worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:6
verses.text: Therefore the worship of the Spirit is not done away with, but His union with the Father is expressed, when it is said that the Father is to be worshipped in Spirit, and this point is supported by similar expressions.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:7
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:8
verses.text: But perhaps reference may be made to the fact that in a later passage of the same book, the Lord again said that God is Spirit, but spoke of God the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:9
verses.text: For you have this passage in the Gospel: "The hour now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in Spirit and truth, for such also doth the Father seek.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:10
verses.text: God is Spirit, and they that worship Him must worship in Spirit and truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:11
verses.text: By this passage you wish not only to deny the divinity of the Holy Spirit, but also, from God being worshipped in Spirit, deduce a subjection of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:12
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:13
verses.text: To which point I will briefly answer that Spirit is often put for the grace of the Spirit, as the Apostle also said: "For the Spirit Himself intercedeth for us with groanings which cannot be uttered;" that is, the grace of the Spirit, unless perchance you have been able to hear the groanings of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:14
verses.text: Therefore here too God is worshipped, not in the wickedness of the heart, but in the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:15
verses.text: "For into a malicious soul wisdom does not enter," because "no one can call Jesus Lord but in the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:16
verses.text: And immediately he adds: "Now there are diversities of gifts".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:17
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:18
verses.text: Now this cannot pertain to the fulness, nor to the dividing of the Spirit; for neither does the mind of man grasp His fulness, nor is He divided into any portions of Himself; but He pours into [the soul] the gift of spiritual grace, in which God is worshipped as He is also worshipped in truth, for no one worships Him except he who drinks in the truth of His Godhead with pious affection.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:19
verses.text: And he certainly does not apprehend Christ as it were personally, nor the Holy Spirit personally.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:20
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:21
verses.text: Or if you think that this is said as it were personally of Christ and of the Spirit, then God is worshipped in truth in like manner as He is worshipped in Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:22
verses.text: There is therefore either a like subjection, which God forbid that you should believe, and the Son is not worshipped; or, which is true, there is a like grace of Unity, and the Spirit is worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:24
verses.text: Let us then here draw our inferences and put an end to the impious questionings of the Arians.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:25
verses.text: For if they say that the Spirit is therefore not to be worshipped because God is worshipped in Spirit, let them then say that the Truth is not to be worshipped, because God is worshipped in truth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:26
verses.text: For although there be many truths, since it is written: "Truths are minished from the sons of men;" yet they are given by the Divine Truth, which is Christ, Who says: "I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:27
verses.text: If therefore they understand the truth in this passage from custom, let them also understand the grace of the Spirit, and there is no stumbling; or if they receive Christ as the Truth, let them deny that He is to be worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:28
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:29
verses.text: But they are refuted by the acts of the pious, and by the course of the Scriptures.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:30
verses.text: For Mary worshipped Christ, and therefore is appointed to be the messenger of the Resurrection to the apostles, loosening the hereditary bond, and the huge offence of womankind.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:31
verses.text: For this the Lord wrought mystically, "that where sin had exceedingly abounded, grace might more exceedingly abound".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:32
verses.text: And rightly is a woman appointed [as messenger] to men; that she who first had brought the message of sin to man should first bring the message of the grace of the Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:34
verses.text: And the apostles worshipped; and therefore they who bore the testimony of the faith received authority as to the faith.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:35
verses.text: And the angels worshipped, of whom it is written: "And let all His angels worship Him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:36
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:37
verses.text: But they worship not only His Godhead but also His Footstool, as it is written: "And worship His footstool, for it is holy".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:38
verses.text: Or if they deny that in Christ the mysteries also of His Incarnation are to be worshipped,  in which we observe as it were certain express traces of His Godhead, and certain ways of the Heavenly Word; let them read that even the apostles worshipped Him when He rose again in the glory of His Flesh.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:39
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:40
verses.text: Therefore if it do not at all detract from Christ, that God is worshipped in Christ, for Christ too is worshipped; it certainly also detracts nothing from the Spirit that God is worshipped in the Spirit, for the Spirit also is worshipped, as the Apostle has said: "We serve the Spirit of God," for he who serves worships also, as it is said in an earlier passage: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:41
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:42
verses.text: But lest any one should perchance seem to elude the instance we have adduced, let us consider in what manner that which the prophet says, "Worship His Footstool," appears to refer to the mystery of the divine Incarnation, for we must not estimate the footstool from the custom of men.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:43
verses.text: For neither has God a body, neither is He other than beyond measure, that we should think a footstool was laid down as a support for His feet.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:44
verses.text: And we read that nothing besides God is to be worshipped, for it is written: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:45
verses.text: How, then, should the prophet, brought up under the Law, and instructed in the Law, give a precept against the Law? The question, then, is not unimportant, and so let us more diligently consider what the footstool is.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:46
verses.text: For we read elsewhere: "The heaven is My throne, and the earth the footstool of My feet".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:47
verses.text: But the earth is not to be worshipped by us, for it is a creature of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:48
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:49
verses.text: Let us, however, see whether the prophet does not say that that earth is to be worshipped which the Lord Jesus took upon Him in assuming flesh.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:50
verses.text: And so, by footstool is understood earth, but by the earth the Flesh of Christ, which we this day also adore in the mysteries, and which the apostles, as we said above, adored in the Lord Jesus; for Christ is not divided but is one; nor, when He is adored as the Son of God, is He denied to have been born of the Virgin.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:51
verses.text: Since, then, the mystery of the Incarnation is to be adored, and the Incarnation is the work of the Spirit, as it is written, "The Holy Spirit shall come upon thee, and the power of the Most High shall overshadow thee, and that Holy Thing Which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God," without doubt the Holy Spirit also is to be adored, since He Who according to the flesh was born of the Holy Spirit is adored.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:52
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:53
verses.text: And let no one divert this to the Virgin Mary; Mary was the temple of God, not the God of the temple.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:54
verses.text: And therefore He alone is to be worshipped Who was working in His temple.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:55
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:56
verses.text: It makes, then, nothing against our argument that God is worshipped in Spirit, for the Spirit also is worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:57
verses.text: Although if we consider the words themselves, what else ought we to understand in the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, but the unity of the same power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:58
verses.text: For what is "must worship in Spirit and in truth"? If, however, you do not refer this to the grace of the Spirit, nor the true faith of conscience; but, as we said, personally (if indeed this word person is fit to express the Divine Majesty), you must take it of Christ and of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:59
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:60
verses.text: What means, then, the Father is worshipped in Christ, except that the Father is in Christ, and the Father speaks in Christ, and the Father abides in Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:61
verses.text: Not, indeed, as a body in a body, for God is not a body; nor as a confused mixture [confusus in confuso], but as the true in the true, God in God, Light in Light; as the eternal Father in the co-eternal Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:62
verses.text: So not an ingrafting of a body is meant, but unity of power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:63
verses.text: Therefore, by unity of power, Christ is jointly worshipped in the Father when God the Father is worshipped in Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:64
verses.text: In like manner, then, by unity of the same power  the Spirit is jointly worshipped in God, when God is worshipped in the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:65
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:66
verses.text: Let us investigate the force of that word and expression more diligently, and deduce its proper meaning from other passages.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:67
verses.text: "Thou hast," it is said, "made them all in wisdom".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:68
verses.text: Do we here understand that Wisdom was without a share in the things that were made? But "all things were made by Him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:69
verses.text: And David says: "By the Word of the Lord were the heavens established".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:70
verses.text: So, then, he himself who calls the Son of God the maker even of heavenly things, has also plainly said that all things were made in the Son, that in the renewal of His works He might by no means separate the Son from the Father, but unite Him to the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:71
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:72
verses.text: Paul, too, says: "For in Him were all things created in the heavens and in the earth, visible and invisible".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:73
verses.text: Does he, then, when he says, "in Him," deny that they were made through Him? Certainly he did not deny but affirmed it.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:74
verses.text: And further he says in another place: "One Lord Jesus, through Whom are all things".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:75
verses.text: In saying, then, "through Him," has he denied that all things were made in Him, through Whom he says that all things exist? These words, "in Him" and "with Him," have this force, that by them is understood one and like in all respects, not contrary.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:76
verses.text: Which he also made clear farther on, saying: "All things have been created through Him and in Him;" for, as we said above, Scripture witnesses that these three expressions, "with Him," and "through Him," and "in Him," are equivalent in Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:77
verses.text: For you read that all things were made through Him and in Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:78
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:79
verses.text: Learn also that the Father was with Him, and He with the Father, when all things were being made.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:80
verses.text: Wisdom says: "When He was preparing the heavens I was with Him, when He was making the fountains of waters".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:81
verses.text: And in the Old Testament the Father, by saying, "Let Us make," showed that the Son was to be worshipped with Himself as the Maker of all things.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:82
verses.text: As, then, those things are said to have been created in the Son, of which the Son is received as the Creator; so, too, when God is said to be worshipped in truth by the proper meaning of the word itself often expressed after the same manner it ought to be understood, that the Son too is worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:83
verses.text: So in like manner is the Spirit also worshipped because God is worshipped in Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 11:84
verses.text: Therefore the Father is worshipped both with the Son and with the Spirit, because the Trinity is worshipped.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:1
verses.text: Chapter XII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:2
verses.text: From the fact that St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:3
verses.text: Paul has shown that the light of the Godhead which the three apostles worshipped in Christ is in the Trinity, it is made clear that the Spirit also is to be worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:4
verses.text: It is shown from the words themselves that the Spirit is intended by the apostles.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:5
verses.text: The Godhead of the same Spirit is proved from the fact that He has a temple wherein He dwells not as a priest, but as God: and is worshipped with the Father and the Son; whence is understood the oneness of nature in Them.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:7
