verses.text: But does any one deny that the Godhead of the eternal Trinity is to be worshipped? whereas the Scriptures also express the inexplicable Majesty of the Divine Trinity, as the Apostle says elsewhere: "Since God, Who said that light should shine out of darkness, shined in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:8
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:9
verses.text: The apostles truly saw this glory, when the Lord Jesus on the mount shone with the light of His Godhead: "The apostles," it says, "saw it and fell on their face".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:10
verses.text: Do not you think that they even, as they fell, worshipped, when they could not with their bodily eyes endure the brightness of the divine splendour, and the glory of eternal light dulled the keenness of mortal sight? Or what else did they who saw His glory say at that time, except, "O come let us worship and fall down before Him"? For "God shined in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:11
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:12
verses.text: Who is He, then, Who shined that we might know God in the face of Jesus Christ? For he said, "God shined," that the glory of God might be known in the face of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:13
verses.text: Whom else do we think but the manifested Spirit? Or who else is there besides the Holy Spirit to Whom the power of the Godhead may be referred? For they who exclude the Spirit must necessarily bring in another, who may with the Father and the Son receive the glory of the Godhead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:15
verses.text: Let us then go back to the same words: "It is God Who shined in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:16
verses.text: You have Christ plainly set forth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:17
verses.text: For Whose glory is said to give light but that of  the Spirit? So, then, he set forth God Himself, since he spoke of the glory of God; if of the Father, it remains that "He who said that light should shine out of darkness, and shine in our hearts," be understood to be the Holy Spirit, for we cannot venerate any other with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:18
verses.text: If, then, you understand the Spirit, Him also has the Apostle called God; it is necessary, then, that you also confess the Godhead of the Spirit, who now deny it.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:20
verses.text: But how shamelessly do you deny this, since you have read that the Holy Spirit has a temple.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:21
verses.text: For it is written: "Ye are the temple of God, and the Holy Spirit dwelleth in you".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:22
verses.text: Now God has a temple, a creature has no true temple.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:23
verses.text: But the Spirit, Who dwelleth in us, has a temple.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:24
verses.text: For it is written: "Your members are temples of the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:25
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:26
verses.text: But He does not dwell in the temple as a priest, nor as a minister, but as God, since the Lord Jesus Himself said: "I will dwell in them, and will walk among them, and will be their God, and they shall be My people".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:27
verses.text: And David says: "The Lord is in His holy temple".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:28
verses.text: Therefore the Spirit dwells in His holy temple, as the Father dwells and as the Son dwells, Who says: "I and the Father will come, and will make Our abode with him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:29
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:30
verses.text: But the Father abides in us through the Spirit, Whom He has given us.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:31
verses.text: How, then, can different natures abide together? Certainly it is impossible.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:32
verses.text: But the Spirit abides with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:33
verses.text: Whence, too, the Apostle joined the Communion of the Holy Spirit with the grace of Jesus Christ and the love of God, saying: "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the Communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:34
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:35
verses.text: We observe, then, that the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit abide in one and the same [subject] through the oneness of the same nature.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 12:36
verses.text: Therefore, He Who dwells in the temple has divine power, for as of the Father and of the Son, so are we also the temple of the Holy Spirit; not many temples, but one temple, for it is the temple of one Power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:1
verses.text: Chapter XIII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:2
verses.text: To those who object that Catholics, when they ascribe Godhead to the Holy Spirit, introduce three Gods, it is answered, that by the same argument they themselves bring in two Gods, unless they deny Godhead to the Son; after which the orthodox doctrine is set forth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:3
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:4
verses.text: But what do you fear? Is it that which you have been accustomed to carp at? lest you should make three Gods.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:5
verses.text: God forbid; for where the Godhead is understood as one, one God is spoken of.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:6
verses.text: For neither when we call the Son God do we say there are two Gods.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:7
verses.text: For if, when you confess the Godhead of the Spirit, you think that three Gods are spoken of, then, too, when you speak of the Godhead of the Son because you are not able to deny it, you bring in two Gods.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:8
verses.text: For it is necessary according to your opinion, if you think that God is the name of one person, not of one nature, that you either say that there are two Gods, or deny that the Son is God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:10
verses.text: But let us free you from the charge of ignorance, though we do not excuse you from fault.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:11
verses.text: For according to our opinion, because there is one God, one Godhead and oneness of power is understood.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:12
verses.text: For as we say that there is one God, confessing the Father, and not denying the Son under the true Name of the Godhead; so, too, we exclude not the Holy Spirit from the Unity of the Godhead, and do not assert but deny that there are three Gods, because it is not unity but a division of power which makes plurality.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 13:13
verses.text: For how can the Unity of the Godhead admit of plurality, seeing that plurality is of numbers, but the Divine Nature does not admit numbers?.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:1
verses.text: Chapter XIV.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:2
verses.text: Besides the evidence adduced above, other passages can be brought to prove the sovereignty of the Three Persons.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:3
verses.text: Two are quoted from the Epistles to the Thessalonians, and by collating other testimonies of the Scriptures it is shown that in them dominion is claimed for the Spirit as for the other Persons.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:4
verses.text: Then, by quotation of another still more express passage in the second Epistle to the Corinthians, it is inferred both that the Spirit is Lord, and that where the Lord is, there is the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:5
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:6
verses.text: God, then, is One, without violation of the majesty of the eternal Trinity, as is declared in the instance set before us.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:7
verses.text: And not in that place alone do we see the Trinity expressed in the Name of the Godhead; but both in many places, as we have said also above, and especially in the epistles which the Apostle wrote to the Thessalonians, he most clearly set forth the Godhead and sovereignty of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:8
verses.text: For you read as follows:  "The Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, as we also do toward you, to the stablishing of your hearts without blame in holiness before God and our Father at the coming of the Lord Jesus".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:10
verses.text: Who, then, is the Lord Who makes us to increase and abound before God and our Father at the coming of the Lord Jesus? He has named the Father and has named the Son; Whom, then, has he joined with the Father and the Son except the Spirit? Who is the Lord Who establishes our hearts in holiness.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:11
verses.text: For holiness is a grace of the Spirit, as, too, is said farther on: "In holiness of the Spirit and belief of the truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:12
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:13
verses.text: Who, then, do you think is here named Lord, except the Spirit? And has not God the Father been able to teach you, Who says: "Upon Whomsoever thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding upon Him, this is He Who baptizeth in the Holy Spirit"? For the Spirit descended in the likeness of a dove, that He might both bear witness to His wisdom, and perfect the sacrament of the spiritual laver, and show that His working is one with that of the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:15
verses.text: And that you should not suppose that anything had fallen from the Apostle by oversight, but that he knowingly and designedly and inspired by the Spirit designated Him Lord, Whom he felt to be God, he repeated the same in the second Epistle to the Thessalonians, saying: "But the Lord direct your hearts in the love of God and in the patience of Christ".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:16
verses.text: If love be of God and patience of Christ, it ought to be shown Who is the Lord Who directs, if we deny that the direction is of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:17
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:18
verses.text: But we cannot deny it, since the Lord said of Him: "I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:19
verses.text: But when He, the Spirit of Truth, shall come, He will lead you into all truth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:20
verses.text: And David says of Him: "Thy good Spirit shall lead me into the right way".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:21
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:22
verses.text: See what the voice of the Lord uttered concerning the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:23
verses.text: The Son of God came, and because He had not yet shed forth the Spirit, He declared that we were living like little children without the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:24
verses.text: He said that the Spirit was to come Who should make of these little children stronger men, by an increase, namely, of spiritual age.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:25
verses.text: And this He laid down not that He might set the power of the Spirit in the first place, but that He might show that the fulness of strength consists in the knowledge of the Trinity.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:26
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:27
verses.text: It is therefore necessary either that you mention some fourth person besides the Spirit of whom you ought to be conscious, or assuredly that you do not consider another to be Lord, except the Spirit Who has been pointed out.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:28
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:29
verses.text: But if you require the plain statement of the words in which Scripture has spoken of the Spirit as Lord, it cannot have escaped you that it is written: "Now the Lord is the Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:30
verses.text: Which the course of the whole passage shows to have been certainly said of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:31
verses.text: And so let us consider the apostolic statement: "As often as Moses is read," says he, "a veil is laid over their heart; but when they shall be turned to the Lord, the veil shall be taken away.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:32
verses.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit; but where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:34
verses.text: So he not only called the Spirit Lord, but also added: "But where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:35
verses.text: So we all with unveiled face, reflecting the glory of the Lord, are formed anew into the same image from glory to glory, as from the Lord the Spirit;" that is, we who have been before converted to the Lord, so as by spiritual understanding to see the glory of the Lord, as it were, in the mirror of the Scriptures, are now being transformed from that glory which converted us to the Lord, to the heavenly glory.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:36
verses.text: Therefore since it is the Lord to Whom we are converted, but the Lord is that Spirit by Whom we are formed anew, who are converted to the Lord, assuredly the Holy Ghost is pointed out, for He Who forms anew receives those who are converted.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:37
verses.text: For how should He form again those whom He had not received.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:38
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:39
verses.text: Though why should we seek for the expression of words, where we see the expression of unity? For although you may distinguish between Lord and Spirit, you cannot deny that where the Lord is, there too is the Spirit, and he who has been converted to the Lord will have been converted to the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 14:40
verses.text: If you cavil at the letter, you cannot injure the Unity; if you wish to separate the Unity, you confess the Spirit Himself as the Lord of power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:1
verses.text: Chapter XV.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:2
verses.text: Though the Spirit be called Lord, three Lords are not thereby implied; inasmuch as two Lords are not implied by the fact that the Son in the same manner as the Father is called Lord in many passages of Scripture; for Lordship exists in the Godhead, and the Godhead in Lordship, and these coincide without division in the Three Persons.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:3
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:4
verses.text: But perhaps, again, you may say: If I call the Spirit Lord, I shall set forth three Lords.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:5
verses.text: Do you then when you call the Son Lord either deny the Son or confess two Lords? God forbid, for the Son Himself said: "Do not serve two lords".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:6
verses.text: But certainly He denied not either Himself or the Father to be Lord; for He called the Father Lord, as you read: "I thank Thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:7
verses.text: And the Lord spoke of Himself, as we read in the Gospel: "Ye call Me Master and Lord, and ye do well, for so I am".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:8
verses.text: But He spoke not of two Lords; indeed He shows that He did not speak of two Lords, when He warns them: "Do not serve two lords".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:9
verses.text: For there are not two Lords where the Lordship is but one, for the Father is in the Son and the Son in the Father, and so there is one Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:11
verses.text: Such, too, was the teaching of the Law: "Hear, O Israel, the Lord thy God is one Lord," that is, unchangeable, always abiding in unity of power, always the same, and not altered by any accession or diminution.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:12
verses.text: Therefore Moses called Him One, and yet also relates that the Lord rained down fire from the Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:13
verses.text: The Apostle, too, says: "The Lord grant unto him to find mercy of the Lord".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:14
verses.text: The Lord rains down from the Lord; the Lord grants mercy from the Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:15
verses.text: The Lord is neither divided when He rains from the Lord, nor is there a separation when He grants mercy from the Lord, but in each case the oneness of the Lordship is expressed.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:16
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:17
verses.text: In the Psalms, too, you find: "The Lord said unto my Lord".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:18
verses.text: And he did not therefore deny that the Father was his Lord, because he spoke of the Son as his Lord; but therefore called the Son his Lord, that you might not think Him to be the Son, but the Lord of the prophet, as the Lord Himself showed in the Gospel, when He said: "If David in the Spirit called Him Lord, how is he his Son?" David, not the Spirit, calls Him Lord in the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:19
verses.text: Or if they falsely infer from this that the Spirit called Him Lord, they must necessarily by a like sacrilege seem to assert that the Son of God is also the Son of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:20
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:21
verses.text: So, as we do not say that there are two Lords, when we so style both the Father and the Son, so, too, we do not say that there are three Lords, when we confess the Spirit to be Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:22
verses.text: For as it is profane to say that there are three Lords or three Gods, so, too, is it utter profanity to speak of two Lords or two Gods; for there is one God, one Lord, one Holy Spirit; and He Who is God is Lord, and He Who is Lord is God, for the Godhead is in the Lordship, and the Lordship is in the Godhead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:24
verses.text: Lastly, you have read that the Father is both Lord and God: "O Lord my God, I will call upon Thee, hear Thou me".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:25
verses.text: You find the Son to be both Lord and God, as you have read in the Gospel, that, when Thomas had touched the side of Christ, he said, "My Lord and my God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:26
verses.text: So in like manner as the Father is God and the Son Lord, so too the Son is God and the Father Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:27
verses.text: The holy designation changes from one to the other, the divine nature changes not, but the dignity remains unchangeable.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 15:28
verses.text: For they are not [as it were] contributions gathered from bounty, but free-will gifts of natural love; for both Unity has its special property, and the special properties are bound together in unity.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:1
verses.text: Chapter XVI.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:2
verses.text: The Father is holy, and likewise the Son and the Spirit, and so They are honoured in the same Trisagion: nor can we speak more worthily of God than by calling Him Holy; whence it is clear that we must not derogate from the dignity of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:3
verses.text: In Him is all which pertains to God, since in baptism He is named with the Father and the Son, and the Father has given to Him to be greater than all, nor can any one deprive Him of this.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:4
verses.text: And so from the very passage of St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:5
verses.text: John which heretics used against His dignity, the equality of the Trinity and the Unity of the Godhead is established.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:6
verses.text: Lastly, after explaining how the Son receives from the Father, St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:7
verses.text: Ambrose shows how various heresies are refuted by the passage cited.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:8
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:9
verses.text: So, then, the Father is holy, the Son is holy, and the Spirit is holy, but they are not three Holies; for there is one Holy  God, one Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:10
verses.text: For the true holiness is one, as the true Godhead is one, as that true holiness belonging to the Divine Nature is one.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:11
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:12
verses.text: So everything which we esteem holy proclaims that Sole Holiness.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:13
verses.text: Cherubim and Seraphim with unwearied voices praise Him and say: "Holy, Holy, Holy, is the Lord God of Sabaoth".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:14
verses.text: They say it, not once, lest you should believe that there is but one; not twice, lest you should exclude the Spirit; they say not holies [in the plural], lest you should imagine that there is plurality, but they repeat thrice and say the same word, that even in a hymn you may understand the distinction of Persons in the Trinity, and the oneness of the Godhead and while they say this they proclaim God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:15
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:16
verses.text: We too find nothing of more worth, whereby we are able to proclaim God, than the calling Him holy.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:17
verses.text: Everything is too low for God, too low for the Lord.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:18
verses.text: And therefore consider from this fact also whether one ought at all to derogate from the Holy Spirit, whose Name is the praise of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:19
verses.text: For thus is the Father praised, thus is the Son also praised, in the same manner as the Spirit also is named and praised.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:20
verses.text: The Seraphim utter praise, the whole company of the blessed utter praise, inasmuch as they call God holy, the Son holy, the Spirit holy.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:21
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:22
verses.text: How, then, does He not possess all that pertains to God, Who is named by priests in baptism with the Father and the Son, and is invoked in the oblations, is proclaimed by the Seraphim in heaven with the Father and the Son, dwells in the Saints with the Father and the Son, is poured upon the just, is given as the source of inspiration to the prophets? And for this reason in the divine Scripture all is called θεόπνευστος, because God inspires what the Spirit has spoken.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:24
verses.text: Or if they are unwilling to allow that the Holy Spirit has all things which pertain to God, and can do all things, let them say what He has not, and what He cannot do.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:25
verses.text: For like as the Son has all things, and the Father grudges not to give all things to the Son according to His nature, having given to Him that which is greater than all, as the Scripture bears witness, saying: "That which My Father hath given unto Me is greater than all".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:26
verses.text: So too the Spirit has of Christ that which is greater than all, because righteousness knows not grudging.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:27
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:28
verses.text: So, then, if we attend diligently, we comprehend here also the oneness of the Divine Power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:29
verses.text: He says: "That which My Father hath given unto Me is greater than all, and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father's hand.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:30
verses.text: I and the Father are One".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:31
verses.text: For if we rightly showed above that the Holy Spirit is the Hand of the Father, the same is certainly the Hand of the Father which is the Hand of the Son, since the Same is the Spirit of the Father Who is the Spirit of the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:32
verses.text: Therefore whosoever of us receives eternal life in this Name of the Trinity, as he is not torn from the Father; so he is not torn from the Son, so too he is not torn from the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:34
verses.text: Again, from the very fact that the Father is said to have given to the Son, and the Spirit to have received from the Son, as it is written: "He shall glorify Me, for He shall take of Mine, and shall declare it unto you" (which He seems to have said rather of the office of distributing, than of the prerogative of Divine Power, for those whom the Son redeemed the Spirit also, Who was to sanctify them, received), from those very words, I say, from which they construct their sophistry, the Unity of the Godhead is perceived, not the need of a gift.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:35
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:36
verses.text: The Father gave by begetting, not by adoption; He gave as it were that which was contained in the very prerogative of the Divine Nature, not what was lacking as it were by favour of His bounty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:37
verses.text: And so because the Son acquires persons to Himself as the Father does; so gives life as does the Father, He expressed His equality with the Father in the Unity of Power, saying: "I and the Father are One".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:38
verses.text: For when He says, "I and the Father," equality is revealed; when He says, "are One," Unity is asserted.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:39
verses.text: Equality excludes confusion; Unity excludes separation.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:40
verses.text: Equality distinguishes between the Father and the Son; Unity does not separate the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:41
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:42
verses.text: Therefore, when He says, "I and the Father," He rejects the Sabellian, for He says that He is one, the Father another; He rejects the Photinian, for He joins Himself with God the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:43
verses.text: With the former words He rejects those, for He said: "I and the Father;" with the latter words He rejects the Arians, for He says: "are One".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:44
verses.text: Yet in both the former and the latter words He refutes the heretical violence (1) of the Sabellians, for He said: "We are One [Substance]," not "We are One[Person]".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:45
verses.text: And (2) of the Arians, for He said: "I and the Father," not "the Father and I".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:46
verses.text: Which  was certainly not a sign of rudeness, but of dutifulness and foreknowledge, that we might not think wrongly from the order of the words.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 16:47
verses.text: For unity knows no order, equality knows no gradation; nor can it be laid to the Son of God that the Teacher Himself of dutifulness should offend against dutifulness by rudeness.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:1
verses.text: Chapter XVII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:2
verses.text: St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:3
verses.text: Ambrose shows by instances that the places in which those words were spoken help to the understanding of the words of the Lord; he shows that Christ uttered the passage quoted from St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:4
verses.text: John in Solomon's porch, by which is signified the mind of a wise man, for he says that Christ would not have uttered this saying in the heart of a foolish or contentious man.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:5
verses.text: He goes on to say that Christ is stoned by those who believe not these words, and as the keys of heaven were given to Peter for his confession of them, so Iscariot, because he believed not the same, perished evilly.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:6
verses.text: He takes this opportunity to inveigh against the Jews who bought the Son of God and sold Joseph.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:7
verses.text: He explains the price paid for each mystically; and having in the same manner expounded the murmuring of the traitor concerning Magdalene's ointment, he adds that Christ is bought in one way by heretics in another way by Catholics, and that those in vain take to themselves the name of Christians who sever the Spirit from the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:8
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:9
verses.text: It is worth while to notice in what place the Lord held this discussion, for His utterances are often [better] estimated by the kind of places in which He conversed.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:10
verses.text: When about to fast, He is led (as we read) into the wilderness to render vain the devil's temptations.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:11
verses.text: For although it deserves praise to have lived temperately in the midst of abundance, yet the enticements of temptation are more frequent amongst riches and pleasures.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:12
verses.text: Then the tempter, in order to try Him, promises Him abundance, and the Lord in order to overcome cherishes hunger.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:13
verses.text: Now I do not deny that temperance can exist in the midst of riches; but although he who navigates the sea often escapes, yet he is more exposed to peril than he who will not go to sea.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:15
verses.text: Let us consider some other points.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:16
verses.text: When about to promise the kingdom of heaven, Jesus went up into a mountain.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:17
verses.text: At another time He leads His disciples through the corn-fields, when about to sow in their minds the crop of heavenly precepts, so that a plentiful harvest of souls should ripen.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:18
verses.text: When about to consummate the work of the flesh which He had taken, having now seen perfection in His disciples, whom He had established upon the root of His words, He enters a garden, that He might plant the young olive-trees in the house of the Lord, and that He might water the just flourishing like a palm-tree, and the fruitful vine with the stream of His Blood.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:20
verses.text: In this passage too He was walking, as we read, in Solomon's porch on the day of the dedication, that is, Christ was walking in the breast of the wise and prudent, to dedicate his good affection to Himself.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:21
verses.text: What that porch was the prophet teaches, saying: "I will walk in the midst of Thy house in the innocency of my heart".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:22
verses.text: So, then, we have in our own selves the house of God, we have the halls, we have also the porches, and we have the courts, for it is written: "Let thy waters flow abroad in thy courts".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:23
verses.text: Open, then, this porch of thy heart to the Word of God, Who says to thee: "Open thy mouth wide and I will fill it".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:24
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:25
verses.text: Let us, therefore, hear what the Word of God, walking in the heart of the wise and peaceful, says: "I and My Father are One".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:26
verses.text: He will not say this in the breast of the unquiet and foolish, for "the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness unto him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:27
verses.text: The narrow breasts of sinners do not take in the greatness of the faith.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:28
verses.text: Lastly, the Jews hearing, "I and the Father are One, took up stones to stone Him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:29
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:30
verses.text: He who cannot listen to this is a Jew; he who cannot listen to this stones Christ with the stones of his treachery, rougher than any rock, and if you believe me, he wounds Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:31
verses.text: For although He cannot now feel a wound: "For now henceforth we know not Christ after the flesh," yet He Who rejoices in the love of the Church is stoned by the impiety of the Arians.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:32
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:33
verses.text: "The law of Thy mouth, O Lord, is good unto me, I keep Thy commandments".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:34
verses.text: Thou hast Thyself said that Thou art one with the Father.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:35
verses.text: Because Peter believed this, he received the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and without anxiety for himself forgave sins.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:36
verses.text: Judas, because he believed not this, strangled himself with the cord of his own wickedness.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:37
verses.text: O the hard stones of unbelieving words! O the unseemly cord of the betrayer, and the still more hideous purchase-money of the Jews! O hateful money wherewith either the just is bought for death, or sold! Joseph was sold, Jesus Christ was bought,  the one to slavery, the Other to death.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:38
verses.text: O detestable inheritance, O deadly sale, which either sells a brother to suffering or sets a price on the Lord to destroy Him, the Purchaser of the salvation of all.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:39
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:40
verses.text: The Jews did violence to two things which are chief of all, faith and duty, and in each to Christ the Author of faith and duty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:41
verses.text: For both in the patriarch Joseph was there a type of Christ, and Christ Himself came in the truth of His Body, "Who counted it not robbery that He should be equal with God, but took on Him the form of a servant," because of our fall, that is to say, taking slavery upon Himself and not shrinking from suffering.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:42
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:43
verses.text: In one place the sale is for twenty pieces, in the other for thirty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:44
verses.text: For how could His true price be apprehended, Whose value cannot be limited? There is error in the price because there is error in the inquiry.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:45
verses.text: The sale is for twenty pieces in the Old Testament, for thirty in the New; for the Truth is of more value than the type, Grace is more generous than training, the Presence is better than the Law, for the Law promised the Coming, the Coming fulfilled the Law.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:46
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:47
verses.text: The Ishmaelites made their purchase for twenty pieces, the Jews for thirty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:48
verses.text: And this is no trivial figure.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:49
verses.text: The faithless are more lavish for iniquity than the faithful for salvation.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:50
verses.text: It is, however, fitting to consider the quality of each agreement.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:51
verses.text: Twenty pieces are the price of him sold to slavery, thirty pieces of Him delivered to the Cross.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:52
verses.text: For although the Mysteries of the Incarnation and of the Passion must be in like manner matters of amazement, yet the fulfilment of faith is in the Mystery of the Passion.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:53
verses.text: I do not indeed value less the birth from the holy Virgin, but I receive even more gratefully the Mystery of the sacred Body.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:54
verses.text: What is more full of mercy than that He should forgive me the wrongs done to Himself? But it is even fuller measure that He gave us so great a gift, that He Who was not to die because He was God, should die by our death, that we might live by His Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:55
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:56
verses.text: Lastly, it was not without meaning that Judas Iscariot valued that ointment at three hundred pence, which seems certainly by the statement of the price itself to set forth the Lord's cross.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:57
verses.text: Whence, too, the Lord says: "For she, pouring this ointment on My body, did it for My burial".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:58
verses.text: Why, then, did Judas value this at so high a rate? Because remission of sins is of more value to sinners, and forgiveness seems to be more precious.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:59
verses.text: Lastly, you find it written: "To whom much is forgiven the same loveth more".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:60
verses.text: Therefore sinners themselves also confess the grace of the Lord's Passion which they have lost, and they bear witness to Christ who persecuted Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:61
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:62
verses.text: Or because, "into a malicious soul wisdom does not enter," the evil disposition of the traitor uttered this, and he valued the suffering of the Lord's body at a dearer rate, that by the immensity of the price he might draw all away from the faith.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:63
verses.text: And therefore the Lord offered Himself without price, that the necessity of poverty might hold no one back from Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:64
verses.text: The patriarchs sold Him for a small price that all might buy.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:65
verses.text: Isaiah said: "Ye that have no money go buy and drink; eat ye without money," that he might gain him who had no money.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:66
verses.text: O traitor Judas, thou valuest the ointment of His Passion at three hundred pence, and sellest His Passion for thirty pence.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:67
verses.text: Profuse in valuing, mean in selling.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:68
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:69
verses.text: So, then, all do not buy Christ at the same price; Photinus, who buys Him for death, buys Him at one price; the Arian, who buys Him to wrong Him, at another price; the Catholic, who buys Him to glorify Him, at another.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:70
verses.text: But he buys Him without money according to that which is written: "He that hath no money let him buy without price".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:71
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:72
verses.text: "Not all," says Christ, "that say unto Me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven!" Although many call themselves Christians, and make use of the name, yet not all shall receive the reward.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:73
verses.text: Both Cain offered sacrifice, and Judas received the kiss, but it was said to him, "Judas, betrayest thou the Son of Man with a kiss?" that is, thou fillest up thy wickedness with the pledge of affection, and sowest hatred with the implement of peace, and inflictest death with the outward token of love.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:74
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:75
verses.text: Let not, then, the Arians flatter themselves with the employment of the name, because they call themselves Christians.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:76
verses.text: The Lord will answer them: You set forward My Name, and deny My Substance, but I do not recognize My Name where My eternal Godhead is not.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:77
verses.text: That is not My Name which is divided from the Father, and  separated from the Spirit; I do not recognize My Name where I do not recognize My doctrine; I do not recognize My Name where I do not recognize My Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:78
verses.text: For he knows not that he is comparing the Spirit of the Father to those servants whom He created.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 17:79
verses.text: Concerning which point we have already spoken at length.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:1
verses.text: Chapter XVIII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:2
verses.text: As he purposes to establish the Godhead of the Holy Spirit by the points already discussed, St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:3
verses.text: Ambrose touches again on some of them; for instance, that He does not commit but forgives sin; that He is not a creature but the Creator; and lastly, that He does not offer but receives worship.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:4
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:5
verses.text: But to sum up, in order at the end more distinctly to gather up the arguments which have been used here and there, the evident glory of the Godhead is proved both by other arguments, and most especially by these four.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:6
verses.text: God is known by these marks: either that He is without sin; or that He forgives sin; or that He is not a creature but the Creator; or that He does not give but receives worship.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:7
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:8
verses.text: So, then, no one is without sin except God alone, for no one is without sin except God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:9
verses.text: Also, no one forgives sins except God alone, for it is also written: "Who can forgive sins but God alone?" And one cannot be the Creator of all except he be not a creature, and he who is not a creature is without doubt God; for it is written: "They worshipped the creature rather than the Creator, Who is God blessed for ever".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:10
verses.text: God also does not worship, but is worshipped, for it is written: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:11
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:12
verses.text: Let us therefore consider whether the Holy Spirit have any of these marks which may bear witness to His Godhead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:13
verses.text: And first let us treat of the point that none is without sin except God alone, and demand that they prove that the Holy Spirit has sin.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:15
verses.text: But they are unable to show us this, and demand our authority from us, namely, that we should show by texts that the Holy Spirit has not sinned, as it is said of the Son that He did no sin.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:16
verses.text: Let them learn that we teach by authority of the Scriptures; for it is written: "For in Wisdom is a Spirit of understanding, holy, one only, manifold, subtle, easy to move, eloquent, undefiled".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:17
verses.text: The Scripture says He is undefiled, has it lied concerning the Son, that you should believe it to have lied concerning the Spirit? For the prophet said in the same place concerning Wisdom, that nothing that defiles enters into her.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:18
verses.text: She herself is undefiled, and her Spirit is undefiled.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:19
verses.text: Therefore if the Spirit have not sin, He is God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:20
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:21
verses.text: But how can He be guilty of sin Who Himself forgives sins? Therefore He has not committed sin, and if He be without sin He is not a creature.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:22
verses.text: For every creature is exposed to the capability of sin, and the eternal Godhead alone is free from sin and undefiled.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:24
verses.text: Let us now see whether the Spirit forgives sins.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:25
verses.text: But on this point there can be no doubt, since the Lord Himself said: "Receive ye the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:26
verses.text: Whosesoever sins ye forgive they shall be forgiven".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:27
verses.text: See that sins are forgiven through the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:28
verses.text: But men make use of their ministry for the forgiveness of sins, they do not exercise the right of any power of their own.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:29
verses.text: For they forgive sins not in their own name but in that of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:30
verses.text: They ask, the Godhead gives, the service is of man, the gift is of the Power on high.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:31
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:32
verses.text: And it is not doubtful that sin is forgiven by means of baptism, but in baptism the operation is that of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:33
verses.text: If, therefore, the Spirit forgives sin, since it is written, "Who can forgive sins except God alone?" certainly He Who cannot be separated from the oneness of the name of the Nature is also incapable of being severed from the power of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:34
verses.text: Now if He is not severed from the power of God, how is He severed from the name of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:35
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:36
verses.text: Let us now see whether He be a creature or the Creator.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:37
verses.text: But since we have above most clearly proved Him to be the Creator, as it is written: "The Spirit of God Who hath made me;" and it has been declared that the face of the earth is renewed by the Spirit, and that all things languish without the Spirit, it is clear that the Spirit is the Creator.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:38
verses.text: But who can doubt this, since, as we have shown above, not even the generation of the Lord from the Virgin, which is more excellent than all creatures, is without the operation of the Spirit?  140.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:39
verses.text: Therefore the Spirit is not a creature, but the Creator, and He Who is Creator is certainly not a creature.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:40
verses.text: And because He is not a creature, without doubt He is the  Creator Who produces all things together with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:41
verses.text: But if He be the Creator, certainly the Apostle, by saying in condemnation of the Gentiles, "Who served the creature rather than the Creator, Who is God blessed for ever," and by warning men, as I said above, that the Holy Spirit is to be served, both showed Him to be the Creator, and because He is the Creator demonstrated that He ought to be called God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:42
verses.text: Which he also sums up in the Epistle written to the Hebrews, saying: "For He that created all things is God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:43
verses.text: Let them, therefore, either say what it is which has been created without the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit, or let them confess that the Spirit also is of one Godhead with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:44
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:45
verses.text: The writer taught also that He was to be worshipped, Whom he called Lord and God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:46
verses.text: For He Who is the God and Lord of the Universe is certainly to be worshipped by all, for it is thus written: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:47
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:48
verses.text: Or let them say where they have read that the Spirit worships.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:49
verses.text: For it is said of the Son of God: "Let all the Angels of God worship Him;" we do not read, Let the Spirit worship Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:50
verses.text: For how can He worship Who is not amongst servants and ministers, but, together with the Father and the Son, has the service of the just under Him, for it is written: "We serve the Spirit of God".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:51
verses.text: He is, therefore, to be worshipped by us, Whom the Apostle taught that we must serve, and Whom we serve we also adore, according to that which is written, to repeat the same words again: "Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:52
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:53
verses.text: Although the Apostle has not omitted even this point, so as to omit to teach us that the Spirit is to be worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:54
verses.text: For since we have demonstrated that the Spirit is in the prophets, no one can doubt that prophecy is given by the Spirit, and plainly when He Who is in the prophets is worshipped, the same Spirit is worshipped.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:55
verses.text: And so you find: "If the whole Church be assembled together, and all speak with tongues, and there come in one unlearned or unbelieving, will he not say that ye are mad? But if all prophesy, and there come in one unlearned and unbelieving, he is convicted by all, he is judged by all.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:56
verses.text: For the secrets of his heart are made manifest, and so falling down on his face he will worship God, declaring that God is in truth among you".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 18:57
verses.text: It is, therefore, God Who is worshipped, God Who abides and Who speaks in the prophets; but the Spirit thus abides and speaks, therefore, also, the Spirit is worshipped.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:1
verses.text: Chapter XIX.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:2
verses.text: Having proved above that the Spirit abides and speaks in the prophets, St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:3
verses.text: Ambrose infers that He knows all things which are of God, and therefore is One with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:4
verses.text: This same point he establishes again from the fact that He possesses all that God possesses, namely, Godhead, knowledge of the heart, truth, a Name above every name, and power to raise the dead, as is proved from Ezekiel, and in this He is equal to the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:5
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:6
verses.text: And so as the Father and the Son are One, because the Son has all things which the Father has, so too the Spirit is one with the Father and the Son, because He too knows all the things of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:7
verses.text: For He did not obtain it by force, so that there should be any injury as of one who had suffered loss; He did not seize it, lest the loss should be his from whom it might seem to have been plundered.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:8
verses.text: For neither did He seize it through need, nor through superiority of greater power did He take it by force, but He possesses it by unity of power.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:9
verses.text: Therefore, if He works all these things, for one and the same Spirit worketh all, how is He not God Who has all things which God has?  145.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:10
verses.text: Or let us consider what God may have which the Holy Spirit has not.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:11
verses.text: God the Father has Godhead, and the Son, too, in Whom dwells the fulness of the Godhead, has it, and the Spirit has it, for it is written: "The Spirit of God is in my nostrils".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:12
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:13
verses.text: God, again, searches the hearts and reins, for it is written: "God searcheth the hearts and reins".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:14
verses.text: The Son also has this power, Who said, "Why think ye evil in your hearts?" For Jesus knew their thoughts.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:15
verses.text: And the Spirit has the same power, Who manifests to the prophets also the secrets of the hearts of others, as we said above: "for the secrets of his heart are made manifest".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:16
verses.text: And why do we wonder if He searches the hidden things of man Who searches even the deep things of God?  147.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:17
verses.text: God has as an attribute that He is true for it is written: "Let God be true and every man a liar".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:18
verses.text: Does the Spirit lie Who is the Spirit of Truth? and Whom we  have shown to be called the Truth, since John called Him too the Truth, as also the Son? And David says in the psalm: "Send out Thy light and Thy truth, they have led me and brought me to Thy holy hill and to Thy tabernacles".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:19
verses.text: If you consider that in this passage the Son is the light, then the Spirit is the Truth, or if you consider the Son to be the Truth, then the Spirit is the light.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:20
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:21
verses.text: God has a Name which is above every name, and has given a name to the Son, as we read that in the Name of Jesus knees should bow.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:22
verses.text: Let us consider whether the Spirit has this Name.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:23
verses.text: But it is written "Go, baptize the nations in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:24
verses.text: He has, then, a Name above every name.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:25
verses.text: What, therefore, the Father and the Son have, the Holy Spirit also has through the oneness of the Name of His nature.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:26
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:27
verses.text: It is a prerogative of God to raise the dead.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:28
verses.text: "For as the Father raiseth the dead and quickeneth them, so the Son also quickeneth whom He will".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:29
verses.text: But the Spirit also (by Whom God raiseth) raiseth them, for it is written: "He shall quicken also your mortal bodies through His Spirit that dwelleth in you".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:30
verses.text: But that you may not think this a trivial grace, learn that the Spirit also raises, for the prophet Ezekiel says: "Come, O Spirit, and breathe upon these dead, and they shall live.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:31
verses.text: And I prophesied as He commanded me, and the Spirit of life entered into them, and they lived, and stood up on their feet an exceeding great company".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:32
verses.text: And farther on God says: "Ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall open your graves, that I may bring My people out of their graves, and I will give you My Spirit, and ye shall live".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:33
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:34
verses.text: When He spoke of His Spirit, did He mention any other besides the Holy Spirit? For He would neither have spoken of His Spirit as produced by blowing, nor could this Spirit come from the four quarters of the world, for the blowing of these winds, which we experience, is partial, not universal; and this spirit by which we live is also individual, not universal.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:35
verses.text: But it is the nature of the Holy Spirit to be both over all and in all.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:36
verses.text: Therefore from the words of the prophet we may see how (the frame-work of the members long since fallen asunder being scattered) the bones may come together again to the form of a revived body, when the Spirit quickens them; and the ashes may come together on the limbs belonging to them, animated by a disposition to come together before being formed anew in the appearance of living.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:37
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:38
verses.text: Do we not in the likeness of what is done recognize the oneness of the divine power? The Spirit raises after the same manner as the Lord raised at the time of His own Passion, when suddenly in the twinkling of an eye the graves of the dead were opened, and the bodies living again arose from the tombs, and the smell of death being removed, and the scent of life restored, the ashes of those who were dead took again the likeness of the living.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:39
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 19:40
verses.text: So, then, the Spirit has that which Christ has, and therefore what God has, for all things which the Father has the Son also has, and therefore He said: "All things which the Father hath are Mine".

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:1
verses.text: Chapter XX.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:2
verses.text: The river flowing from the Throne of God is a figure of the Holy Spirit, but by the waters spoken of by David the powers of heaven are intended.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:3
verses.text: The kingdom of God is the work of the Spirit; and it is no matter for wonder if He reigns in this together with the Son, since St.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:4
verses.text: Paul promises that we too shall reign with the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:5
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:6
verses.text: And this, again, is not a trivial matter that we read that a river goes forth from the throne of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:7
verses.text: For you read the words of the Evangelist John to this purport: "And He showed me a river of living water, bright as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:8
verses.text: In the midst of the street thereof, and on either side, was the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruits, yielding its fruit every month, and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of all nations".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:9
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:10
verses.text: This is certainly the River proceeding from the throne of God, that is, the Holy Spirit, Whom he drinks who believes in Christ, as He Himself says: "If any man thirst, let him come to Me and drink.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:11
verses.text: He that believeth on Me, as saith the Scripture, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:12
verses.text: But this spoke He of the Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:13
verses.text: Therefore the river is the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:14
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:15
verses.text: This, then, is in the throne of God, for the water washes not the throne of God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:16
verses.text: Then, whatever you may understand by that water, David said not that it was above the throne of God, but above the heavens,  for it is written: "Let the waters which are above the heavens praise the Name of the Lord".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:17
verses.text: Let them praise, he says, not let it praise.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:18
verses.text: For if he had intended us to understand the element of water, he would certainly have said, Let it praise, but by using the plural he intended the Powers to be understood.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:19
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:20
verses.text: And what wonder is it if the Holy Spirit is in the throne of God, since the kingdom of God itself is the work of the Holy Spirit, as it is written: "For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:21
verses.text: And when the Saviour Himself says, "Every kingdom divided against itself shall be destroyed," by adding afterwards, "But if I, by the Spirit of God, cast out devils, without doubt the kingdom of God is come upon you," He shows that the kingdom of God is held undivided by Himself and by the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:22
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:23
verses.text: But what is more foolish than for any one to deny that the Holy Spirit reigns together with Christ when the Apostle says that even we shall reign together with Christ in the kingdom of Christ: "If we are dead with Him, we shall also live with Him; if we endure, we shall also reign with Him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:24
verses.text: But we by adoption, He by power; we by grace, He by nature.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:25
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 20:26
verses.text: The Holy Spirit, therefore, shares in the kingdom with the Father and the Son, and He is of one nature with Them, of one Lordship, and also of one power.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:1
verses.text: Chapter XXI.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:2
verses.text: Isaiah was sent by the Spirit, and accordingly the same Spirit was seen by him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:3
verses.text: What is meant by the revolving wheels, and the divers wings, and how since the Spirit is proclaimed Lord of Sabaoth by the Seraphim, certainly none but impious men can deny Him this title.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:4
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:5
verses.text: Since, then, He has a share in the kingdom, what hinders us from understanding that it was the Holy Spirit by Whom Isaiah was sent? For on the authority of Paul we cannot doubt, whose judgment the Evangelist Luke so much approved in the Acts of the Apostles as to write as follows in Paul's words: "Well spake the Holy Spirit through Isaiah the prophet to our fathers, saying: Go to this people and say, Ye shall hear with the ear and shall not understand, and seeing ye shall see and shall not perceive".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:6
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:7
verses.text: It is, then, the Spirit Who sent Isaiah.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:8
verses.text: If the Spirit sent him, it is certainly the Spirit Whom, after Uzziah's death, Isaiah saw, when he said: "I saw the Lord of Sabaoth sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and the house was full of His majesty.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:9
verses.text: And the Seraphim stood round about Him, each one had six wings, and with two they were covering His face, and with two they were covering His feet, and with two they were flying; and they cried out one to the other, and said, Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of Sabaoth, the whole earth is full of His majesty".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:10
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:11
verses.text: If the Seraphim were standing, how were they flying? If they were flying, how were they standing? If we cannot understand this, how is it that we want to understand God, Whom we have not seen?  162.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:12
verses.text: But as the prophet saw a wheel running within a wheel (which certainly does not refer to any appearance to the bodily sight, but to the grace of each Testament; for the life of the saints is polished, and so consistent with itself that later portions agree with the former).

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:13
verses.text: The wheel, then, within a wheel is life under the Law, life under grace; inasmuch as Jews are within the Church, the Law is included in grace.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:14
verses.text: For he is within the Church who is a Jew secretly; and circumcision of the heart is a sacrament within the Church.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:15
verses.text: But that Jewry is within the Church of which it is written: "In Jewry is God known;" therefore as wheel runs within wheel, so in like manner the wings were still, and the wings were flying.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:16
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:17
verses.text: In like manner, too, the Seraphim were veiling His face with two wings, and with two were veiling His feet, and with two were flying.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:18
verses.text: For here also is a mystery of spiritual wisdom.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:19
verses.text: Seasons stand, seasons fly; the past stand, the future are flying, and like the wings of the Seraphim, so they veil the face or the feet of God; inasmuch as in God, Who has neither beginning nor end, the whole course of times and seasons, from this knowledge of its beginning and its end, is at rest.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:20
verses.text: So, then, times past and future stand, the present fly.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:21
verses.text: Ask not after the secrets of His beginning or His end, for there is neither.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:22
verses.text: You have the present, but you must praise Him, not question.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:23
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:24
verses.text: The Seraphim with unwearied voices praise, and do you question? And certainly when they do this they show us that we must not sometimes question about God,  but always praise Him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:25
verses.text: Therefore the Holy Spirit is also the Lord of Sabaoth.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 21:26
verses.text: Unless perchance the Teacher Whom Christ chose pleases not the impious, or they can deny that the Holy Spirit is the Lord of powers, Who gives whatever powers He Himself wills.

chapters.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:1
verses.text: Chapter XXII.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:2
verses.text: In proof of the Unity in Trinity the passage of Isaiah which has been cited is considered, and it is shown that there is no difference as to its sense amongst those who expound it of the Father, or of the Son, or of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:3
verses.text: If He Who was crucified was Lord of glory, so, too, is the Holy Spirit equal in all things to the Father and the Son, and the Arians will never be able to diminish His glory.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:4
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:5
verses.text: It is now possible to recognize the oneness of the majesty and rule in the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:6
verses.text: For many say that it was God the Father Who was seen at that time by Isaiah.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:7
verses.text: Paul says it was the Spirit, and Luke supports him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:8
verses.text: John the Evangelist refers it to the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:9
verses.text: For thus has he written of the Son: "These things spake Jesus, and departed and hid Himself from them.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:10
verses.text: But though He had done so great signs before them, they did not believe on Him, that the word of Isaiah might be fulfilled which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report, and to whom hath the Arm of the Lord been revealed? Therefore, they could not believe, because Isaiah said again, He hath blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, that they might not see with their eyes and understand with their heart and be converted, and I should heal them.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:11
verses.text: These things said Isaiah when he saw His glory, and spake of Him".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:12
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:13
verses.text: John says that Isaiah spoke these words, and revealed most clearly that the glory of the Son appeared to him.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:14
verses.text: Paul, however, relates that the Spirit said these things.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:15
verses.text: Whence, then, is this difference?  167.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:16
verses.text: There is, indeed, a difference of words, not of meaning.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:17
verses.text: For though they said different things, neither was in error, for both the Father is seen in the Son, Who said, "He that seeth Me seeth the Father also," and the Son is seen in the Spirit; for as "no man says Lord Jesus, except in the Holy Spirit," so Christ is seen not by the eye of flesh, but by the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:18
verses.text: Whence, too, the Scripture says: "Rise, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall shine upon thee".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:19
verses.text: And Paul, when he had lost his eyesight, how did he see Christ except in the Spirit? Wherefore the Lord says: "For to this end I have appeared unto thee, to appoint thee a minister and a witness of the things wherein thou hast seen Me, and of the things wherein thou shalt see Me".

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:20
verses.text: For the prophets also received the Spirit and saw Christ.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:21
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:22
verses.text: One, then, is the vision, one the right to command, one the glory.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:23
verses.text: Do we deny that the Holy Spirit is also the Lord of glory when the Lord of glory was crucified who was born from the Holy Spirit of the Virgin Mary? For Christ is not one of two, but is one, and was born as Son of God of the Father before the world; and in the world born as man by taking flesh.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:24
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:25
verses.text: And why should I say that, as the Father and the Son, so, too, the Spirit is free from stain and Almighty, for Solomon called Him in Greek παντοδύναμον, πᾶνέπίσχοπον , because He is Almighty and beholds all things, as we showed above to be, is read in the Book of Wisdom.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:26
verses.text: Therefore the Spirit enjoys honour and glory.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:27
Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:28
verses.text: Consider now lest perchance something may not beseem Him, or if this displease thee, O Arian, drag Him down from His fellowship with the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:29
verses.text: But if thou choose to drag Him down thou wilt see the heavens reversed above thee, for all their strength is from the Spirit.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:30
verses.text: If thou choose to drag Him down, thou must first lay hands on God, for the Spirit is God.

verses.name: Ambrose: On the Holy Spirit Book III 22:31
verses.text: But how wilt thou drag Him down, Who searcheth the deep things of God?.
